text: Bradley Cooper plays it down an outrider
whose life is pretty much coming apart
except he's just met an old friend who
gives him an experimental pharmaceutical
that kind of allows him to be the
perfect version of himself
it's like steroids for the brain so then
the idea was how do you you know show
what that feels like and my idea was
that he's almost having an out-of-body
experience there's not actually you know
10 of him or two of him here three of
them it's more that's just the way he
feels he can do the work of 10 people
with his intense focus we did this with
a motion control setup where the camera
does multiple passes at the same scene
but he's done doing different action in
each of them and the drug isn't about
being you know high or wired it's about
being clear knowing what to do and how
to do it and so then he's inspired to
get back to his book and get his book
done so again then the challenge was and
the fun was you know showing what that
really feels like and so my first idea
was that the letters falling or the
words that he was thinking of inspired
to write or falling sort of out of the
sky right onto his laptop and you know
we we shot it with that in mind all the
scenes of him and then we in
post-production we added the falling
letters and the falling words and
there's strings of words that he's
writing for his book
